content.en: Hybrid groundwater models: Researchers have been exploring the use of algorithms to improve the accuracy of predicting and estimating various aspects of river and groundwater systems. They have found that hybrid models, which combine wavelet decomposition and artificial intelligence techniques, outperform conventional models in terms of accuracy. These models, such as the wavelet-neural network hybrid model and the wavelet-support vector regression model, provide higher accuracy in forecasting water flow, electrical conductivity, water level, salinity, and groundwater levels. By integrating machine learning with wavelet transform and phase space reconstruction, researchers have been able to significantly improve the accuracy of groundwater level forecasting.
content.da: Hybrid grundvandsmodeller: Forskere har undersøgt brugen af algoritmer for at forbedre nøjagtigheden af forudsigelse og estimering af forskellige aspekter af flod- og grundvandssystemer. De har fundet ud af, at hybridmodeller, der kombinerer wavelet-dekomponering og kunstig intelligens teknikker, overgår konventionelle modeller med hensyn til nøjagtighed. Disse modeller, såsom wavelet-neurale netværks hybridmodel og wavelet-support vektor regressionsmodel, giver højere nøjagtighed i forudsigelse af vandstrøm, elektrisk ledningsevne, vandstand, salinitet og grundvandsniveauer. Ved at integrere maskinlæring med wavelet-transformation og fase-rum rekonstruktion har forskere været i stand til markant at forbedre nøjagtigheden af forudsigelse af grundvandsniveauer.
